jodd.cache

Class AbstractCacheMap<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jodd.cache.AbstractCacheMap<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cache<K,V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FIFOCache, LFUCache, LRUCache, TimedCache

    public abstract class AbstractCacheMap<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cache<K,V>
    Default implementation of timed and size cache map. Implementations should:
    • create a new cache map
    • implements own prune strategy
    Uses ReentrantReadWriteLock to synchronize access. Since upgrading from a read lock to the write lock is not possible, be careful withing get(Object) method.

      • put

        public void put(K key,
                V object,
                long timeout)
        Adds an object to the cache with specified timeout after which it becomes expired. If cache is full, Cache.prune() is invoked to make room for new object. Cached value must be non-null.
        Specified by:
        put in interface Cache<K,V>

      • snapshot

        public java.util.Map<K,V> snapshot(boolean peek)
        Creates a snapshot from current cache values. Returned values may not longer be valid or they might be already expired! Cache is locked during the snapshot creation.
        Specified by:
        snapshot in interface Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        peek - if set, snapshot will just peek the object and not get them (and modify last access)
